1: It can restrict access to certain information in order to prevent unauthorised access 
2: It can cache recently requested resources for faster resource fetching 
3: It allows for anonymous usage of the internet (to a degree) as the server to which a request is being made will only see the proxy servers IP address rather than the clients
Servers.What are print servers: A server that allows computers on the network to connect with one or more printers that are connected to the network
Servers.What are database servers: Servers that allows for the entering and searching of information in a process commonly called querying
Servers.What is the purpose of domain name syste: DNS servers are responsible for translating URLs into IP address (think of them like phone books)

Connection devices.What is a hub: A device that connects all nodes together/to a network
Connection devices.Why are hubs considered 'dumb' devices: All devices connected to a hub will see all information that arrives at the hub. As such hubs are considered dumb as they cannot tell what device requested the data and as a result must send it to every device
Connection devices.What is a switch, how does it differ fro: A device that functions very much like a hub in the sense that it connects all nodes to a network, but unlike a hub it can determine the device that requested the data
Connection devices.How does a switch identify the device th: The switch reads the data packets in order to identify the IP address of the device it needs to deliver to
Connection devices.What is a modem: A device that connects a single node to an external network such as the internet
Connection devices.What is a router: A device that acts as both a switch and a moden
Connection devices.What is a wireless access point/array (W: WAPs allow wireless devices to connect wirelessly to a wired network
Connection devices.What is a repeater: A network repeater is used to amplify an incoming signal, allowing it to travel a greater distance
Connection devices.What is a gateway: A gateway on a network joins different types of networks together, for example a router acts as a gateway when it connects a LAN to the internet
Connection devices.What is a network bridge: A network bridge is used to divide a network into two smaller parts or to connect two similar networks
Connection devices.What is a network interface cards (NIC): A network interface card is used to connect a node, usually a computer, to a network via a cable or wireless transmission

Security of information.What is a network administrator responsi: The network administrator is responsible for protecting the network, managing users and for the process of storing and backing up data
Security of information.Explain how users should be managed in r: Usernames and passwords should be issued to users in order to set individual levels of access to different sections of the network
Security of information.Why are network users often allocated in: By allocating permissions to a group it is much quicker than allocating and setting permissions for each individual user
Security of information.Why does some data need to be backed up: Vital data should have a copy made as the original is still being written to storage, this is done whenever any loss of data could be very expensive
Security of information.Outline the three-generation/grandfather: This is a rotation scheme for backing up data, in which there are three backup cycles, with the newest being called the son
Security of information.What is a firewall: Hardware or software used to block unauthorised access to a network

Network topology.What is a network topology: The layout of a network is referred to as the networks topology
Network topology.Outline a star topology: A network where a small number of computers are connected to a central point, such as a hub or a switch
Network topology.What are the advantages of star topologi: It is easy to setup and add extra devices to
Network topology.What are the disadvantages of star topol: They require a large amount of cabling and if the central hub goes down the whole network will go down
Network topology.Who uses star topologies: Small businesses and sections of large corporations or campus networks
Network topology.Outline a bus topology: A network in which all devices are connected along a single cable
Network topology.What device is found at either end of a: Terminators will be found at either end of a network utilising a bus topology
Network topology.What is the purpose of terminators: Terminators absorb signals so that they do not reflect back down a cable
Network topology.What is the main advantage of bus topolo: It uses far less cabling than some other topologies
Network topology.What is the main disadvantage of bus top: Collisions could occur along the cable, so systehs had to be developed to avoid this. And the devices on the cable all have to share the bandwidth
Network topology.Outline a ring topology: A network in which devices are connected in a 'ring', making each device act as a repeater
Network topology.What is the main disadvantage of ring to: The network cannot be easily extended without interrupting the working of the network
Network topology.What are hybrid networks: Networks that connsist of many different topologies
Network topology.Outline a mesh topology: A network in which each computer has a connection to many other computers, so that is one link fails the data can be transmitted by another path

Network operating systems.What is a network operating system: The software that enables the network administrator to manage user account, control access and security, and ensure the network is running smoothly
Network operating systems.What is a user profile, how is it useful: A user profile allows a user to switch between computers but keep their environtment the same
Network operating systems.Why do network operating systems often e: It prevents any unauthorised users from intercepting and reading the data
Network operating systems.Why do network operating systems often c: It reduces the space that the data needs, therefore saving storage
Network operating systems.What is a disadvantage of compressing da: The process of compressing data is CPU-intensive and can therefore slow the performance of the network briefly
